title: Use Meaningful Variable Names
description: Always use descriptive and meaningful variable names that make the purpose of the variable clear.

title: Keep Functions Small
description: Write small, single-purpose functions to make your code easier to test and maintain.

title: Use Version Control
description: Always use version control, such as Git, to track changes in your codebase.

title: Avoid Global Variables
description: Minimize the use of global variables to reduce the risk of bugs caused by variable scope issues.

title: Comment Your Code Wisely
description: Write comments to explain why you did something, rather than what the code is doing.

title: Understand Asynchronous Programming
description: Learn how to work with async code to avoid blocking the main thread, especially in JavaScript.

title: Use List Comprehensions
description: In Python, use list comprehensions for more concise and readable code.

title: Avoid Premature Optimization
description: Don’t optimize your code until you know it’s necessary. Focus on writing clear and correct code first.

title: Use Meaningful Commit Messages
description: Write commit messages that clearly describe the changes you made and why.

title: Learn and Use Design Patterns
description: Understand common design patterns to solve recurring problems in software design effectively.
